bibl.title: Letter from L.M. Fisher to Henry Rose Carter, October 4, 1922

div1.p: Fisher requests Carter's suggestions for water projects in North Carolina.

div1.head: Letter from L.M. Fisher to Henry Rose Carter, October 4, 1922
div1.opener:
N. M. C.
Imp'd Water
JAMES A. HAYNE, M. D.
Secretary and State Health Officer
L. M. FISHER
Associate Sanitary Engineer
U. S. Public Health Service
In Charge Malaria Co-operative Work
State Board of Health
of South Carolina
DIVISION MALARIA CO-OPERATIVE WORK
Columbia Oct. 4, 1922.
Dr. H. R. Carter
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I have just received orders from Dr. Fricks to
make thorough surveys of water projects at Marion
and Baden, North Carolina.

Since you are already familiar with these projecta
I would appreciate any suggestions you can make
indicating along what lines particularly the
investigation should be conducted this fall.

I fear that the present low water will not show the
conditions that might be typical in July and August.
Please address me at Raleigh, in care of Dr. Rankin.

Boldridge was in the office a few days ago and
conveyed your message to me.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, L. M. Fisher
Associate Sanitary Engineer.
